title: Can anyone offer a suggestion of a script font that would be similar to the Warner Brother's font used on a 1934 movie poster "Smarty"
author: DenaMJ

comments.content:
When I try to open the link to the picture I get the message  
Forbidden

You don't have permission to access /htdocs/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/warner-bros-movie-poster-1934-smarty.jpg on this server.  
Apache/2.2.22 Server at annyas.com Port 80

Don

Don, click the link then refresh page, it has worked for me this way.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018205959im_/http:/typophile.com/files/warner-bros-movie-poster-1934-smarty_5036.jpg)

Thanks Ryuk. Still couldnt't get it to work in Firefox. Worked fine in Explorer with javascript disabled.  
Add to the list New Berolina [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/new-berolina-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018205959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/new-berolina-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/new-berolina-mt/") Caprice BQ [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/caprice-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018205959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/caprice-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/caprice-bq/") Impala Script [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sideshow/impala-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018205959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sideshow/impala-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/sideshow/impala-script/") Janagrace [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jonahfonts/janagrace/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018205959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jonahfonts/janagrace/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jonahfonts/janagrace/") Fabius [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jonahfonts/fabius/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018205959/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jonahfonts/fabius/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jonahfonts/fabius/")  
Working link for Yesteryear [https://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Yesteryear](http://web.archive.org/web/20141018205959/https:/www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Yesteryear "https://www.google.com/fonts/specimen/Yesteryear")  
Don
Nice list Don and thanks for the correct link for Yesteryear (fixed mine, damned 'https'...).
